page.title: 19St.Cleer Carnival.
page.content: St Cleer Carnival is an annual event held during July. Leading up to the Carnival itself are various activities, such as the all-important choosing of the Carnival Queen and her attendants. The week begins with a Fashion Show on Monday and a village Street Dance on Tuesday. On Wednesday we have a Sports Night. There is a Senior Citizens' Lunch on Thursday followed by a Junior Disco. On Friday we have a Fun Run through the village. The Carnival assembles at the Horizon Egg Farm on Saturday evening. The walkers and floats then prepare for the 3 km procession through the village led by the Liskeard Silver Band. They pass through Shortacross, Tremar, Well Lane and Fore Street. Prizes are presented finally on St. Cleer Downs. The money collected goes towards the Memorial Hall Fund.
